title: Water pH and pOH at 37 degrees C

content.question: The value of <math alttext="K sub w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="37 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="2.4 times 10 to the negative 14 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></msup></math>. Which of the following statements about the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="p O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of pure water at <math alttext="37 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is correct?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H is less than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>pH</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7</mn></math> and <math alttext="p O H is greater than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>></mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7</mn></math> because water dissociates to a lesser extent at <math alttext="37 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="p H is greater than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>></mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7</mn></math> and <math alttext="p O H is less than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mtext>H</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7</mn></math> because the dissociation of water is endothermic, and <math alttext="p H plus p O H, equals 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="p H equals p O H, which is less than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H = pOH</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7</mn></math> because water dissociates to a greater extent at <math alttext="37 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="p H equals p O H, which equals 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>pOH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the molar concentration of H 3 O with a positive 1 charge equals, the molar concentration of O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>3</mn></msub><msup><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.07em"></mspace><mtext>]</mtext><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><msup><mtext>OH</mtext><mo>-</mo></msup><mtext>]</mtext></math> for pure water.

content.answer: <math alttext="p H equals p O H, which is less than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H = pOH</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mo><</mo><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>7</mn></math> because water dissociates to a greater extent at <math alttext="37 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
